newsitem.title: CHINA: GUANGDONG INV BUYS HK$330 MLN PROPERTY.
newsitem.headline: GUANGDONG INV BUYS HK$330 MLN PROPERTY.

text.p: Guangdong Investment Ltd said it agreed to buy 12 residential units and 12 carpark spaces in Hong Kong's Repulse Bay Road from a third party for HK$330 million.
The purchase would be funded by internal resources, the company said in a statement on Monday.

"The purchase represents a further step in the growth of the company's property investment business and a further example of its ability to source high quality projects in one of the company's five core business activities," the statement said.
Guangdong Investment's core activities are industrial, infrastructure and energy projects, travel and hotel operation, property development and investment, and wholesale and retail.
The company said it would continue to acquire similar assets in Hong Kong and China when available at attractive prices.
The company shares eased HK$0.10 to HK$11 at midday.
